She and her husband aim to become successful and financially stable in order to educate their children and give them a bright future. For this reason, she engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. 

She plans to raise more pigs to sell but she does not have enough capital. For that reason, she is asking for additional capital of  P27,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted, as it will serve as a way for her to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is a 45-year-old mother from Nyalenda in Kisumu city. She is married to George, who is a businessman, and they have two children who are 21 and 18 years old.

She operates a tailoring kiosk, which she has been doing for the last 15 years, and makes a monthly income of about KES14,000. Wilfrida has applied for her eighth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to pay school fees for her daughter and also to buy fabric materials for making dresses.

She is hoping to keep on having KADET as her partner in financial aid.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school fees and also to buy fabric materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now. Marjorie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more bananas to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity or piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

She faces the major challenge of customers taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Saumu operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables. She sells her produce to town dwellers and neighbors at the market. Her greatest business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a cafe in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 10. He describes himself as patient. He operates a farm where he grows crops for sale and also keeps goats. He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. 

Paul will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs as well as more goats. His business goal is to have a butchery within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He also sells goats to supplement his income. He wants to be a distributor of animals to all butcheries within the region.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs as well as more goats.

loans.name: Gloria Nelcy

texts.es:
Gloria de 23 años de edad, es una joven guerrera, con gran trayectoria en el mundo laboral a pesar de su corta edad. Asegura que uno de sus grandes sueños siempre ha sido convertirse en empresaria y crear su propio negocio, con el fin de ofrecer un servicio carente en su localidad mejorando la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar. 
A pesar tener un plan de negocio trazado, Gloria no cuenta con los recursos económicos para ejecutar su proyecto, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de panela al por mayor para convertirse en un centro de acopio  en donde se comercialice y se distribuya el producto.
Espera alcanzar el punto de equilibrio y ser competente para permanecer en el mercado local.
texts.en:
Gloria is twenty-three years old and is a fighting young woman with a lot of experience in the working world despite her young age.  She says that one of her greatest dreams has always been to make herself into a businesswoman and to start her own business, with the final goal being to offer a service that is lacking in her community and to improve the quality of life for her nuclear family.

Despite having a business plan laid out, Gloria does not have the economic resources in order to execute her plan.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will invest in the purchase of unrefined whole cane sugar wholesale.  She will make herself into a collection center where she sells and distributes this product.

She hopes to reach the break-event point and to be competent in order to remain in the local market.

loans.use: to buy unrefined whole cane sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal and fuel wood for sale.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is grateful for the previous loan he received from the lenders. His business is on the rise and he now intends to take out another loan. He is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell. He believes the business has taken root and that he will be able to cover his needs and raise his repayment amount.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aska

texts.en:
Aska is a 65-year-old mother from Migori County; she is married to Abisa and they have four children who are grown up.

She has a "posho" (corn-grinding) mill within their location, a business that has been in operation for the last five years. She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase grains to sell in line with her "posho" mill. 


She will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business. She hoping to progress in whatever she does for her family.

loans.use: To purchase grain to sell at her posho (cornmeal) mill.

loans.name: Santos Rene

texts.es: Don Santos vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola cuando sus cosechas ya esta lista la va almacenando en los graneros que muestra la fotografia,  Santos  necesita invertir en insumos agricolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Santos lives with his wife and two children.  He works in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  He's been doing this for many years and has gained valuable experience that allows him to produce the best harvests.  The land he works is in an agricultural area.  When the harvest is ready he stores it in granaries, as shown in the photo.  Santos has to invest in farming supplies, for which he needs capital, so he's seeking a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.  He has good credit references and is sure he'll be able to pay off the loan on time, and he's confident he'll be able to provide his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Doña adelina se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y frijol y pueda seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Adelina earns her living growing corn and beans.  She lives with her husband and 4 children.  She's a hardworking woman and very responsible with her household obligations; she's always been known for providing the best for her children.  She's seeking a loan so she can buy fertilizers, pesticides, etc., as shown in the photo, and tools for growing corn and beans, so she can keep bringing in the daily bread for her household without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Penny

texts.en:
Penny lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a hardware store selling timber, cement, nails, etc. The business has been in operation for five years. She also owns rental houses which provide income, too.

Penny learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is price fluctuations. She has an emergency need to renovate part of the premises and is therefore asking for a loan.

Penny  is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to renovate the store.

loans.use: To renovate the store.

loans.name: Guma

texts.en:
Guma is a male Ugandan aged 56, married to Fausta, with seven children aged 22, 20, 18, 16, 12, 9 and 3. Six of these children attend school. He has no other dependents because he already has a big family.

Guma is engaged in Waragi (Local brew) brewing; he operates six days a week and 13 hours in a day. He started in 1992 and his business is located in Kamaira  where all his clients come from. His additional income comes from agriculture, mainly cassava growing, and transport by motor bike. He began the business out of inspiration from his late father.

Guma wants a loan of 1,400,000 UGX to buy a motorcycle to ease the transportation of his alcohol. He would like lenders to continue giving different types; he is shrewd in business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport his alcohol

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 49-year-old house decorator in Mishomuhoroni Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother who supports nine in their family. Her spouse brings in additional income. She has been in this business for the last three years and has done well.

This marks her third time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase decor materials of wall mats, chair cloths, and curtain material. 

She plans to use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes her business will grow to give employment to the youth.

loans.use: to purchase decor materials of wall mats, chair cloths, and curtain material.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is married and has five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition, she also does farming, which earns her another source of income.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina works hard to support her family. Paulina is single and raises livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Paulina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccine and vitamins for her livestock.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccine and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a business lady living in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child and runs a number of businesses ranging from a fruit parlour, a salon, clothes and ladies' ornaments. She was glad to be introduced to Milango by her friends and though the businesses have been in operation for close to ten years, she joined to access credit for their expansion.

She is therefore applying for a loan of 95,650 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and a freezer for the business.

She looks forward to opening a mega boutique.

loans.use: To buy clothes and a freezer.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging from 8 to 22 years old. She describes herself as active. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with plenty of customers and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. Previously, she was selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.
